name: Cheesesteak Roll-Ups
description: Caramelized onions, bell pepper, mushrooms, and grated cheese rolled inside strips of beef that are cooked to tender perfection. Delicious with Idahoan Signature™ Russets Mashed Potatoes and beef gravy.
recipeIngredient: 1 ½ pounds skirt steak, trimmed and cut into 4-inch wide strips
½ green bell pepper, seeded and chopped
1 (9.74 ounce) package Idahoan Signature™ Russets Mashed Potatoes

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
Place beef strips in a shallow dish and cover with Worcestershire sauce. Turn to coat both sides. Let marinate at room temperature as you prepare the filling.

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened and starting to brown, about 3 minutes. Add bell pepper and mushrooms. Cook stirring frequently 3 additional minutes.

Transfer beef strips from Worcestershire sauce to a cutting board; season with salt and pepper. Place a thin layer of cheese down the length of each beef strip. Add a layer of the vegetable mix down the length of each strip. Top each strip with another layer of cheese.
Starting at the end nearest you carefully roll each beef strip over the filling all the way to the end and place in a baking sheet seam side down. Secure with a toothpick if necessary.

Bake in preheated oven to desired doneness, about 15 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 130 degrees F (54 degrees C). Remove from the oven and let rest 5 minutes.
Prepare Idahoan Signature™ Russets Mashed Potatoes according to package directions. Heat gravy in a saucepan over medium heat.
Cut each cheesesteak roll into slices prior to serving; top with gravy. Serve with Idahoan Signature™ Russets Mashed Potatoes.

review.reviewBody: This turned out so good for us! I did tweak it though. I marinated the meat like the recipe stated and made the filling as directed. When I filled the steak and rolled them I had so much filling leftover that I decided to use that in the gravy too. So I deglazed my pan with some red wine and added my canned gravy to the filling mixture. It made a great sauce for the finished product. Also to my potatoes I added some dried minced onions some parsley flakes and some grated parmesan to give it some additional flavor. This was a great dinner and I love how quick and easy these potatoes are to make!

We really enjoyed these! They couldn't have been easier to make and the flavor was great. I actually realized when it was too late to go to the store that I was out of bell pepper and I ended up doubling the mushroom instead and it was still delicious. I had never used canned gravy before- ever- but it was tasty and a timesaver for sure and it really worked nicely to pull together the steak and potatoes. I really loved how nicely the potatoes turned out both the flavor and texture were great. Thanks to those short cuts I was able to pull this together for my family on a busy weeknight and make everyone's taste buds happy!

I didn't make any changes. The taste was okay but it was definitely on the tough side even though I was careful not to overcook. I think if I did this one again I would marinate the meat a lot longer or tenderize it some first. I would also add a little garlic and red wine to the sauce.

Oh em yum! This is hands down an amazing recipe! I'm not too much a fan of canned gravy but understand it can be a timesaver. If you have time make the gravy at home and it will still be a five star recipe.
This was a nice twist on a cheesesteak! This made the perfect weeknight meal I have to say im not normally a fan of instant potatoes BUT I sure am NOW! They are DELICIOUS! My whole family Loved them!

This was very tasty. I used brachiole steaks. They come paper thin so it was perfect for this dish. The steak is a little fatty so it s great for roasting. Keeps the moisture in. I had 8 steaks which was the perfect amount with one onion two small red bell peppers and 2 cups mozzarella for the filling. I didn t add 5he mushrooms. I served this with butter flavor Idahoan potatoes for the fam and smashed cauliflower for me. Yummy. Along with beef gravy in a jar. This was good enough to make again..

Very good and easy. Perfect for a work night. I loved that the flavors were just like a Cheesesteak. The potatoes were even better than I expected. I don't usually use jarred gravy but I was pleasantly surprised by that too. I will make this one again.

These were delicious. I did a few rolls minus the mushrooms for the mushroom haters I very much preferred them with the mushrooms. I forgot the gravy while I was at the store so we didn't have gravy with it but this dish was still great without it. I rarely use instant potatoes to be honest I usually mess them up so I avoid them. But the Idahoan Signature Russets Mashed Potatoes came together easily and they were pretty good. Good texture and flavor.

This recipe was true to my heart as a fan of Philly Cheesesteaks! I loved this steak roll-up served with a side of Idahoan Mashed Potatoes it truly is comfort food at it's best! The flavors melded together perfectly!
